lead_paragraph: The move would have involved little sacrifice on the part of oil producers, but they remained unable to reach an accord.

byline.contributor: Stanley Reed reported from Doha, and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow.
byline.original: By STANLEY REED and ANDREW E. KRAMER

headline.print_headline: Oil Nations  Fail to Agree on a Freeze in Output
headline.main: In Doha, Major Oil Exporters Fail to Agree on Production Freeze

snippet: The move would have involved little sacrifice on the part of oil producers, but they remained unable to reach an accord.
abstract: Meeting of Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries officials and Russian representatives fails to reach deal to freeze oil production; had been intended to shore up prices and give appearance of cooperation between Russia and Saudi Arabia, but failure could send prices tumbling instead.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
